page.title: 09Trimley St.Mary-Landowners
page.content: Most of Trimley was part of an estate which was bought by Trinity College, Cambridge in the 1930s. They have sold some land for house building but they still own most of the farm land and the land on which the dock and warehouses have been built. Some of us went to see the Land Agents, Bidwell's, who look after the estate for Trinity College.They have an office in the village. We were told what land agents do. The farms are mostly rented and the land agent talks to the farmers about their plans and decides how much rent to charge.Searsons Farm is farmed "in hand" by the agent. We were told that most of the land is good quality,Grade 2 or 3 agricultural land, which would cost about one thousand eight hundred pounds an acre.
